question:
A large company in your area has decided to spend a certain amount of money, either to sponsor a local children’s sports team for two years, or to pay for two open-air concerts. It has asked for feedback from the general public.

Write a letter to the company.

In your letter,


 
describe the benefits of sponsoring the sports team
summarise the benefits of paying for the concerts
say how you think the company should spend the money
text: I am writing this letter with reference to your request to provide public feedback regarding your company's sponsorship proposal.

The budget allocated to a sports team would definitely assist the team to take training from a highly qualified professional to prepare them for their upcoming competitions. In addition to this, they can utilise the capital to purchase a few necessary types of equipment as most of the children lack financial stability.

Although the money seems beneficial to the team, it can also be advantageous if the open-air concerts are organised. This will boost the morale of local residents along with bringing the public together due to their love for music.
In my opinion, the company sponsoring the local sports team in current situations sounds fair as they lack the required assistance and resources to represent our society.
Hope this feedback would be helpful. Should you require any further details, please let me know.
